items.title: Amazon is turning Fallout’s post-apocalypse into a reality show
items.summary: Move over Squid Game: another bleak fictional world is being turned into competitive reality television. In the midst of season 2 of Fallout, Amazon has announced a new series called Fallout Shelter. According to a casting call, the show will put competitors inside of Fallout's iconic vaults and then test their survival skills in a […]

items.title: Alienware’s popular 34-inch QD-OLED gaming monitor is down to its lowest price today at $500
items.summary:
We are now tracking a deal at Amazon that drops Alienware’s AW3423DWF 34-inch 165Hz QD-OLED gaming monitor down to $499.99 shipped. This is originally a $900 display that has lately been fetching close to $650 in recent months. Today’s deal shaves $150 off its usual going rate, marking the return of the lowest price it first hit during the Black Friday sale a couple of months back. Dell is also matching the price for this monitor today at its online store, so be sure to snag it after getting more details below.

items.title: China donates medical supplies to Burundi
items.summary: BUJUMBURA, Jan. 15 (Xinhua) -- The Chinese Embassy in Burundi on Thursday donated medical supplies to the Burundian government to help the East African nation achieve sustainable development goals as well as its development vision. Read full story

items.title: 2nd LD Writethru: Explosion, fire in Utrecht injures at least four
items.summary: THE HAGUE, Jan. 15 (Xinhua) -- At least four people were injured in an explosion and major fire in the Dutch city of Utrecht on Thursday afternoon, local authorities said. Read full story

items.title: X revises its developer API policies to "no longer allow apps that reward users for posting on X (aka "infofi")", amid a backlash about growing AI slop on X (André Beganski/Decrypt)
items.summary:
André Beganski / Decrypt:
X revises its developer API policies to “no longer allow apps that reward users for posting on X (aka “infofi")", amid a backlash about growing AI slop on X  —  X is making major changes to its API to prevent access by “InfoFi” crypto projects that seek to incentivize “reply spam,” an exec said.

items.title: Macron says France now providing two thirds of intelligence to Ukraine
items.summary: PARIS, Jan 15 (Reuters) - ‌President Emmanuel Macron said on Thursday that France was now providing two-thirds ‌of intelligence information to Ukraine, largely replacing the United States, which until ‌last year had delivered the bulk of those services. Read full story

items.title: Trump sees Iranian crackdown easing, Tehran denies man to be executed
items.summary: DUBAI/WASHINGTON, Jan 15 (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump said he ‌had been told that killings in Iran's crackdown on protests were easing and that he believed there was no current plan for large-scale executions, adopting a wait‑and‑see posture after earlier threatening intervention. Read full story

items.title: Microsoft is closing its employee library and cutting back on subscriptions
items.summary: Microsoft's library of books is so heavy that it once caused a campus building to sink, according to an unproven legend among employees. Now those physical books, journals, and reports, and many of Microsoft's digital subscriptions to leading US newspapers, are disappearing in a shift described inside Microsoft as an "AI-powered learning experience." Microsoft started […]

items.summary: LONDON, Jan. 15 (Xinhua) -- Britain's economy expanded marginally during the period from September to November 2025, with real gross domestic product (GDP) rising by 0.1 percent compared with the three months to August, estimates from the Office for National Statistics (ONS) showed Thursday. items.summary: WASHINGTON, Jan 15 (Reuters) - ‌The International Monetary Fund said on Thursday ‌that any re-engagement with Venezuela following ‌the U.S. capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro would depend on member governments representing a majority of IMF voting ‍power recognizing a successor regime. items.title: Save up to $700 on these two Segway Navimow H series robot lawn mowers starting from $999
items.summary:
Through Segway’s official Navimow Amazon storefront, you can currently find two of the brand’s H Series Robot Lawn Mowers getting some significant savings after spending much of 2025 keeping to higher rates, with the H1500N-VF robot at $999 shipped, while the H3000N-VF robot is down at $1,299 shipped. Both of these models are no longer available direct from the brand’s website, but you can find the lesser H800-VF robot at $1,299 shipped there, making these two Amazon deals all the better, as you get more yard coverage with them. They’d normally go for $1,599 and $1,999 at full price these days, though we’ve been seeing them hold at $1,299 and $1,599 since December, with things going even lower today. While we have seen the price in past years drop further, you’re still looking at solid $600 and $700 markdowns that are worth considering while you upgrade to smarter and more autonomous mowing.

more…

items.summary:
Deals on Apple’s latest USB-C Magic Mouse have been rare and slight at best. Regularly $79, we have tracked not much more than a large handful of deals over the last year, and they are typically quite short-lived. Over at Best Buy though, folks looking to refresh their Apple mouse will find one of the lowest prices we have tracked to date that also includes the Apple warranty.

items.title: Double your Switch 2’s storage while Samsung’s P9 Express microSD card is down to just $35
items.summary:
We are now tracking a deal at Amazon that drops Samsung’s 256GB P9 Express microSD card down to $34.99 shipped. This Switch 2-compatible memory card typically goes for $55, so you’re looking at a straight-up 36% discount on it right now. It fell to $33 last month during the holiday sale, and it’s currently within $2 of that all-time low price. The 512GB model is also discounted to $107.99 shipped, down from its $120 price. The prices on SSDs, memory cards, and other storage devices have been steadily climbing lately, so you might want to jump in there now to snag the discounts. Head below for more details.

items.title: EcoFlow’s 2,048Wh DELTA 3 Max power station gets $450 flash savings to its second-best $749 rate, more from $429
items.summary:
It’s the last day to take advantage of EcoFlow’s New Year power station sale, and we wanted to shine one final spotlight on the current flash sale offers that are ending with the event at midnight. Right alongside the new low prices hitting the DELTA Pro 3 station and RIVER 2 Pro solar bundle, you can also score EcoFlow’s newer DELTA 3 Max Portable Power Station at $749 shipped, matching its Amazon pricing. While the unit carries a $1,499 MSRP, it starts lower at $1,199 over at Amazon, with discounts recently having been keeping the costs hovering at $799 since extended Cyber Monday $699 low ended last month. You’re looking at a $450 markdown off the going rate (and $750 off the MSRP) for the second-lowest price we have tracked. Head below for more info on this unit and the other offers while they are still live.

Today’s deal shaves $30 off its usual going rate, marking one of the lowest prices we have tracked for it to date. It briefly dropped to $57 during the Black Friday sale a couple of months back, and it’s now within just $2 of that price. It remains a good option to consider if you’re in the market to buy a reliable gimbal, and you can learn more about it in detail below.

It is currently offering proper U.S. boxed copies on sale at $58.99 Prime shipped (a $6 delivery fee will apply otherwise). That might not be a giant discount from the regular $70 price drop, but it is your best bet and among the best opportunities we have tracked to land a copy on sale since release. It also might very well be the best chance to score it before the new Super Mario Galaxy Movie hits the silver screen in April.

items.title: Quickly add 1TB storage to your phone or laptop with SanDisk’s USB-C flash drive at a $60 all-time low (Reg. $140)
items.summary:
Today only, as part of its daily deals, Woot is offering SanDisk’s 1TB USB-C flash drive in Arctic White finish for $59.99 Prime shipped (a $6 delivery fee will apply otherwise). This is regularly a $140 drive, which is currently fetching its full price at Amazon. Today’s Woot offer delivers a whopping 57% discount, shaving $80 off its usual going rate. It’s available in a bunch of finishes, but only the white one is available at this price today, so snag it before the offer expires. Alternatively, you can also grab the 64GB variant for $19.99 Prime shipped, down from its $40 usual going rate. Head below for more details.
